content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a civil case between two parties referred to as xx and cc in the pärnu county court in estonia xx requested the division of joint assets and compensation from cc following their divorce the court partially satisfied the claim and ordered the termination of joint ownership of a property leaving it solely in ccs ownership the court also ordered cc to compensate xx with €78083 the court considered the arguments and evidence presented by both parties and made its decision based on the current family law act the court deviated from the equal division of assets based on xxs lack of valid reasons for not contributing to the joint assets the court ordered the division of the assets and awarded compensation to xx the court also ruled that the loan balance should be deducted from the value of the immovable property the court found that the defendant should repay the loan taken out during their cohabitation the court ruled in favor of the defendant and ordered the claimant to compensate the defendant the court also found that the claimant used the loan amounts for personal expenses and should repay the loan taken to purchase joint assets the court determined the compensation amount to be €780825 the court released the claimant from the loan obligation the court agreed that the defendant had the right to set off the amount transferred to the claimants account the court found that the defendant no longer had the right to demand compensation from the claimant for loan payments the court allowed the claimants request to change the ownership record the court considered the claimants request to sell the property at a public auction and divide the money between the parties the court found that dividing the joint assets or selling them at auction may not be fair the court concluded that the costs of the proceedings should be borne by the parties involved
